intro: Aureolaria pedicularia subsp. typica, commonly known as common honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small white or pink flowers that bloom in summer, followed by distinctive white, silky seed pods. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it often grows in disturbed soils along roadsides and fields. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions as a garden plant.
